intro: Ethulia gracilis, commonly known as the slender ethulia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its slender stems and lanceolate leaves contribute to its distinctive appearance. Ethulia gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
